I hold my breathe when ordering clothing online. But this was a win!  It has the feel and comfort of a quality sweatshirt, but the style and class of a nice sweater. The red was true Christmas red, and I wore it to an expensive, trendy restaurant Christmas party. Add a piece of nice jewelry and it looked very classy with my black skirt. I had several compliments!I did have to steam it for quite a while to get the initial wrinkles out. It comes in a shrink wrapped bag and that’s why I took off a star. Clothing that comes this way makes it feel cheap. But once I put it on, it didn’t feel cheap. It appears just like the photo, free flowing but not at all thin. It’s thick enough it doesn’t wrinkle with a seatbelt, or riding in a car. The tail keeps its shape, doesn’t fold and look silly.  I’m tall, and I do wish it was a bit longer, but I took care of that with a light, longer shawl. I usually look for tunics that are 34-36”.  I haven’t measured but I’d guess this to be 33”. It was slightly shorter than most my tunics, but the free flow design made it comfortable enough get past that.

The top is cute.  I’m pear shaped and it fits me great. If you’re busty, you may not like the fit.  I took off one star because I’m tall and I was counting on the 33” length stated on the size chart for an XXL. The top is actually 33” from the top of the collar which sits a couple of inches above the base of the neck.  From the base of the neck (which is how center back length is usually measured) it’s more like 31”.  This isn’t a deal breaker, it just means I won’t wear it with leggings.
It’s a cute top but it wasn’t for me as I am just 5’2”. It looks better on a taller person
